etermine the strength of such ad hominem arguments.
A related  case  occurs  when  someone  is  accused  of  inconsistency  over
time. If your neighbor says that the best time to prune roses is in the au-
tumn, but then the next spring she tells you that the spring is the best time
to prune roses, this inconsistency would give you some reason to doubt her
expertise as a gardener. Maybe over the winter she got new information that
